meanings.definition: In a manner that is necessary or required
meanings.sent1: She obligately followed the rules at school.
meanings.sent2: The student obligately completed the assignment on time.
meanings.sent3: The cat obligately meowed for attention when the owner returned home.
meanings.sent4: The flowers obligately turned towards the sun for warmth.
meanings.sent5: The chef obligately added salt to enhance the flavor of the dish.

meanings.definition: Unable to survive or reproduce without a particular condition or factor
meanings.sent1: The obligately dependent plant needed constant sunlight to thrive.
meanings.sent2: The obligately attached twins always stayed close to each other.
meanings.sent3: The obligately picky eater refused to try any new foods.
meanings.sent4: The obligately nocturnal owl hooted softly in the night.
meanings.sent5: The obligately social butterfly enjoyed attending parties every weekend.
